para.para.body: How to recognize a system of linear equations with no solution.
How to recognize a system of linear equations with exactly one solution.
How to recognize a system of linear equations with infinitely many solutions.
Given a system of linear equations, the following apply
The system has no solution exactly when the RREF of the augmented coefficient matrix has a leading 1 in its augmented part
The system has exactly one solution exactly when the RREF of the augmented coefficient matrix has a leading 1 in each column of its non-augmented part and no leading 1 in its augmented part

The system has infinitely many solutions exactly when the RREF of the augmented coefficient matrix has all leading 1 ’s in the non-augmented part, and there is at least one non-augmented column without a leading 1 . In this case the number of free variables describing the collection of all solutions is equal to the number of variables less the number of leading 1 ’s.
